colormap_segmentation_labels[source]

colormap_segmentation_labels(N=256)

create a colour map for segmentation labels

save_png_p[source]

save_png_p(img:ndarray, fn, cmap:str='hot', num_colors=256)

Save an image as an 8 bit png file with a color map

  • img:
  • fn: filename to save
  • cmap: colormap ( use matplotlib cmaps )
  • num_colors: less than 256, for label images set number to the number of colors in the colormap

{% include image.html alt="Example colour maps" caption="Example colour maps" max-width="800" file="images/colormaps_001.png" %}

{% include image.html alt="Example colour maps" caption="Example colour maps" max-width="800" file="images/colormaps_002.png" %}

Use a Quantative color map for label images and set number to the number of colors in the colormap save_png_p(img, 'file.png', cmap='tab10', num_colors=10)

{% include image.html alt="Quantative color maps" caption="Quantative color maps" max-width="800" file="images/colormaps_reference_04.png" %}

img = np.random.rand(10,10)
img = cv2.resize(img, dsize=(200, 200), interpolation=cv2.INTER_NEAREST)
save_png_p(np.resize(img,(200,200)), 'images/save_png_p_test.png', cmap='hot')

{% include image.html alt="images/save_png_p_test.png" caption="images/save_png_p_test.png" max-width="400" file="images/save_png_p_test.png" %}
